data.title: Fifty Point Conservation Area

data.text:
The marina is one of the best on western Lake Ontario, with docking spaces for 330 boats and a double boat launch. Other marina facilities include a fully serviced gas dock and pump-out station, visitor docks, hydro hook-ups, water, showers, washrooms, and winter storage facilities. Fifty Point Marina has been honoured with the achievement of a Diamond rating under the Clean Marine program.

The marina can be contacted on Channel 68 VHF.

Dry Dock Storage

Looking to store your boat this season? Fifty Point offers dry dock storage from April 1 to September 30. Boats must be on trailers and will be stored in our fenced compound. Customers who use this program will also receive a pass that allows vehicle entry into the park (valid for dry dock period), access to water and hydro and unlimited use of the boat ramp. Contact Fifty Point at 905-525-2187 for more information and to sign up today!

Whether your group is big or small, we have you covered! Fifty Point welcomes small or large group events, like family reunions and corporate picnics. We offer two covered picnic pavilions as well as a variety of uncovered group areas that are available by reservation. There are also many picnic tables available throughout the day-use area and do not require reservations. Alcohol is not permitted at any time.

Pavilion and Group Area Rentals.

Fifty Point has one of the warmest and cleanest beaches on western Lake Ontario. Change rooms are conveniently located at the nearby beach house.

Be smart this summer season and follow all water safety rules. No lifeguards are provided at our beaches. Adults, children are your responsibility.

Water Quality Testing

Fifty Point is tested weekly during the summer months by Niagara Region Public Health and results are posted on the Niagara Region website .
